title: Unusable
comment: When creating a new task can not change the name. Changed only subtasks. Please fix it!

title: Great Potential, Taskwarrior Support not Quite Ready for the Big Time
comment: The app looks decent and even claims Taskwarrior "support". Unfortunately, it has serious  problems. Upon Sync tasks that were marked complete from an actual Taskwarrior instance get marked as pending. Mirakel also re-writes all recurrence, tag, and annotation data whether it was changed in the app or not...a serious No-No. Additionally, as a final insult, Mirakel doesn't support in any way what makes Taskwarrior a killer app to begin with: the programmatic automatic task sorting. Removing.

title: Nice!
comment: Really handy tool to use with task warrior.
I am a fan of mirakkel. So I loved it

title: Best task list for owncloud
comment: Thank you so much for the great app. i love it!  best if the widget date is shorter or less prominent for 2x2 widget, schedule for sync

title: Note taking
comment: Any chances of using S Pen for note user to draw or having quick writing on the go?

title: Powerful open source task management across devices
comment: Fantastic GUI that uses the powerful taskwarrior task management software, built on open source principles. The developers are very responsive and open to receiving feedback.

title: What I was looking for
comment: Ad free, open source, useful, beautiful. Caldav sync yet a bit cumbersome.

title: Finally I'm in control of my task list
comment: I have been looking for a proper open source task list so I can control my data rather than flining it off to some unknown cloud. Here it is the perfect solution, even works better than half the proprietary apps out there

title: Still no good CalDAV
comment: Please focus on making CalDAV work without a custom built DAVDroid.  I want to stay up to date regarding DAVDroid. So the custom build is no option.

Please tell this the DAVDroid team.
We've ask them to merge the code, but they told us to do this maybe in some later version (0.8).
So from our side there is no showstopper.

Best Georg

title: Great APP but not what i was looking for
comment: The subtask management is awesome. Finally a note taking APP were you can link subtasks and so in. As a galaxy note user I'm in love with drawing into my notes. Lacking this feature is the only cause I don't stay with it.

title: GTD dreamland
comment: Le me say that I really like Taskwarrior, but switched to Emacs due to its Orgmode/MobileOrg not having proper companion for my Android phone. However, after finding out and trying Mirakel, I'm now back to Vim and Taskwarrior happily syncing my tasks with my own Taskserver. Mirakel provides much better interface than MobileOrg and is actively developed with easily approachable devs. No need to look further for awesome GTD tool on your phone.

title: Awesome (and only?) app for taskwarrior users
comment: Using mirakel extensively with my own taskd and it never gave me troubles. Works flawlessly, user experience is really nice and the meta lists are extremely flexible.   Update: Thanks for the quick reply - I totally overlooked the recurrence button. Works great.

Hey Gordon,
Thank you for your feedback. You could already create recurring tasks by clicking the button on the right side of the due date. It's ugly but we are currently redesigning the UI and everything will get better and faster: https://github.com/MirakelX/mirakel-android/issues/451
Best,
Anatolij

title: Great for task management
comment: Works with local servers wonderfully including raspberry pi

title: Awesome when used correctly
comment: Taskd on my own box. Awesome to have it all working with my phone as well!

title: Mirakel
comment: This app is awesome
Too buggy to rely on
Please write a bugreport, so we could try to fix this.

title: Good thing I had taskd backups
comment: Syncing with mirakel botched my tasks.  It marked many tasks as active and modified hundreds of tasks. Even if fixed I'm concerned about trusting with my task data in the future.  Hooray for backups,  sigh, had high hopes.

Hey Will,
I am very sorry for that. We will try to fix that as fast as possible. We will try to test the taskwarrior sync in the near future to prove that nothing can go wrong.
If you like to help us, just write us an email to mirakel@azapps.de We are happy for every help.
Best, Anatolij

title: Very good
comment: Would be better if after checking the box, the task would be crossed out to sort it out visually

title: Buggy and low-quality
comment: First up, the feature set looks great. If only it actually worked. I setup a task server as expected, except it crashed every time I tried to sync with taskd.  So instead I tried my own WebDAV tasks server. That didn't crash, but it never pushed my changes up to the server (any time the server-side copy changed, it would just override what I had).  Finally, the touch targets for the UI are terrible. They're too small, and each button doesn't have enough padding, so they're clumped together (on both an HTC One and Nexus 7)

Hey,
It would be nice if you could contact us (mirakel@azapps.de) so we can solve the problems with taskd together. If you have reported the crashes then the fixes for them will come very soon.
For the other problem I created a new issue here: https://github.com/MirakelX/mirakel-android/issues/292
Best, Anatolij

title: I love it!
comment: Priorities, sub tasks and the progress bar are really useful features!  Checkboxes in the widget would be nice though.

Hey Vincent,
I have opened some issues on our github page: https://github.com/azapps/mirakel-android/issues/283 (and 284,285)
Please check them out.
We like the logo. (It seems that most of our users like it too). You can of course build your own version of Mirakel with your logo ;)
Best, Anatolij

title: Latest update crashes
comment: The previous update made task editing inaccessible. This latest update made the whole app inaccessible. I feel really bad that I have to move away from this app. It had been really awesome.

Hey Kelvin,
I feel real sorry, that this happens. It would be nice if we can fix the problem soon. Could you send us please a bug-report vial the bug-sending dialog? Without it we don't know where to search.
Please write us an E-Mail to mirakel@azapps.de with a description what exactly happens.
Thank you, Anatolij

title: Practical, easy and user-friendly Open Source App
comment: Widget is very practical. Features continuously improving.

title: Okay
comment: The recurrence feature appears as a circular symbol in landscape mode, but it's too small to be recognizable in portrait mode. When I try to delete tasks, they still show up.  I like Tasks: Astrid To-Do List Clone better because it has a better interface, synchronization is not as complicated, and it allows timers for tasks. The only thing I like better with this app is that it allows tasks to be repeated by days of the week.

The icon will be fixed soon(should be visible in both modes).
We cannot reproduce the issue with the deleted tasks. So it would be great if you could provide some further information like android-version or used device.

Best Georg

title: It trashed taskd data twice
comment: It trashed taskd data twice

If you could provide some further data, like the version of taskd and mirakel and describe what happend with the data, we could try to fix this.

Best Georg

title: Mutilated task list on my taskwarrior server
comment: Used this app on my phone and tablet and regular taskwarrior on my laptop. After adding new list and some tasks to it on a phone, then syncing on phone, tablet and laptop I observed: all task entries were tripled, task that were not assigned a project had now a project 'Inbox', tags were cleared from most of the entries.

Thanks for reporting this.
The issue with the tags and the change of the project to Inbox are known and already fixed in our git.
The next release will contain this fixes.
We cannot reproduce the issue with the task-tripling so it would be great if you can mail us(to mirakel@azapps.de) some details about your setup.
Best Georg

title: Great app
comment: The first thing that I like about this app is that it is open source :) . Then it has huge chunk load of features to choose from. And since it is being developed so fast, bugs are being removed pretty rapidly.

title: Great app under rapid  development
comment: Like lots of others I've been looking for a permanent solution since Astrid abruptly shut down, I've tried several but none have really gelled. Mirakel is great and improving quickly. Looking forward to task warrior sync stabilising.

Hey Daniel,
Please try it now to sync with taskwarrior. It should work (it's working for me for weeks without problems ;) )
Best,
Anatolij

title: Much better than Keep
comment: This is wonderful. I have been using it for a while and I can say that with a widget, it becomes very powerful.

title: Could replace astrid...
comment: Real potential here. I can't get the taskwarrior sync to work yet though....

Hey Jamie,
You can try to setup the sync now. If you like, you could just use our server. It's really easy to set it up (hopfully).
Best,
Anatolij

title: Awesome.
comment: No ads. Code is public. Has a good widget. Is clean and lean. I want to pay, go pro. You're worth it.
Open source TODO-LIST app

title: Could not sync
comment: Using caldav with owncloud.  Error says requires https.  I am using ssl but I think I must be entering the url wrong.  For owncloud it is something like: https://your.owncloud.site/remote.php/caldav/  how do I enter this in your app?  I'll give five stars as it is probably my fault.

Hey William,
Thank you for your feedback. Please send us an email (mirakel@azapps.de) with your problems, so we can answer you directly and if there is a bug, fix it.

Regards,
Anatolij
Great app, look forward to more.

title: The ToDo App
comment: This is how you develop a useful ToDo application for mobile devices, period.

title: Great ToDo List App!!!
comment: Exactly the ToDo list app i've been looking for years! Why can't be every app so simple and user-friendly?
